title: introduction
text: retrieve list tables: retrieve dataflow info:
code: dfs <- list_dataflows() dfs[, 1:5] |>    head() #>   agencyID             id version #> 1      NL1 DF_TESTSET_X01     1.0 #> 2      NL1 DF_TESTSET_X02     1.0 #> 3 NL1.CNVT       DF_00370     1.0 #> 4 NL1.CNVT    DF_03726ned     1.0 #> 5 NL1.CNVT       DF_03761     1.0 #> 6 NL1.CNVT       DF_03777     1.0 #>                                                                          name #> 1                                       TESTSET (dataflow, only for TESTSET!) #> 2                                       TESTSET (dataflow, only for TESTSET!) #> 3 Redenen die een belangrijke rol speelden om uit huis gaan (OG'98),1960-1969 #> 4                                Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009 #> 5                     Verkiezingsuitslag en zetelverdeling Tweede Kamer, 1963 #> 6                                                                Woonuitgaven #>                      description #> 1 for testing .Stat applications #> 2 for testing .Stat applications #> 3                           <NA> #> 4                           <NA> #> 5                           <NA> #> 6                           <NA> ref <- dfs$ref[4] print(ref) #> [1] "NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)"  df <- get_dataflow_structure(ref = ref) df #> Dataflow: [NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)] #>   "Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009" #>   agency: "NL1.CNVT", id: "DF_03726ned", version: "1.0" #>  #> Observation columns:  #>   "Topics", "Perioden", "OBS_VALUE", "UNIT_MEASURE", "UNIT_MULT", "OBS_MISSING", "DECIMALS", "OBS_STATUS" #>  #> Get a default selection of the observations with: #>   obs <- get_observations(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #> Get a default selection of the data with: #>   dat <- get_data(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT", pivot="Perioden") #>  #>  #> Properties: #>  $id, $agencyID, $version, $name, $description, $dimensions, $measure, $attributes, $columns, $ref, $flowRef, $raw_sdmx, $default_selection obs <-   obs <- get_observations(id="DF_37230ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #>  #> * `filter_on` argument not specified, using default selection: #>    filter_on = list( #>   Perioden = c("2024MM01", "2024MM02", "2024MM03", "2024MM04", "2024MM05", "2024MM06", "2024MM07", "2024MM08", "2024MM09", "2024MM10", "2024MM11", "2024MM12", "2024JJ00"), #>   RegioS = "NL01" #>    ) #> *  To select all data, set `filter_on` to `NULL`. head(obs) #>      RegioS Perioden                                 Topics OBS_VALUE #> 1 Nederland     2024 Bevolking aan het begin van de periode  17942942 #> 2 Nederland     2024                Levend geboren kinderen    165404 #> 3 Nederland     2024                            Overledenen    171945 #> 4 Nederland     2024                       Totale vestiging   1116236 #> 5 Nederland     2024   Vestiging vanuit een andere gemeente    802164 #> 6 Nederland     2024                             Immigratie    314072 #>   OBS_STATUS UNIT_MEASURE UNIT_MULT          OBS_MISSING #> 1  Voorlopig       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 2  Voorlopig       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 3  Voorlopig       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 4  Voorlopig       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 5  Voorlopig       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 6  Voorlopig       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Jonge E (2025). sdmxdata: Open Data SDMX API Client. R package version 0.2.9000, https://edwindj.github.io/sdmxdata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sdmxdata: Open Data SDMX API Client},   author = {Edwin {de Jonge}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.9000},   url = {https://edwindj.github.io/sdmxdata/}, }

title: Open Data SDMX API Client
text: Work progress, used production work sdmxdata? package designed provide simple interface retrieve select data open statistical data providers support SDMX v2.1 REST API. focusses : retrieving list dataflows: list_dataflows, getting overview available tables (aka dataflows) data provider, including descriptions. retrieving structure dataflow: get_dataflow_structure, getting detailed information structure metadata dataflow. retrieving data: get_data get_observations selecting retrieving data dataflow. functions allow easy filtering server dimensions, reporting periods, metadata. retrieving list agencies subagencies: list_agencies, getting overview agencies. implement full fledged SDMX metadata model data model. , can use rsdmx.

title: Open Data SDMX API Client
text: can install development version sdmxdata GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("edwindj/sdmxdata")

title: Open Data SDMX API Client
text: retrieve list tables: retrieve dataflow structure: retrieve data use get_data get underlying observations get_observations retrieve list agencies subagencies:
code:
library(sdmxdata) CBSbeta <- sdmxdata::get_endpoint("NL1") dfs <- CBSbeta |> list_dataflows() dfs[,1:5] |> head() #> agencyID id version #> 1 NL1 DF_TESTSET_X01 1.0 #> 2 NL1 DF_TESTSET_X02 1.0 #> 3 NL1.CNVT DF_00370 1.0 #> 4 NL1.CNVT DF_03726ned 1.0 #> 5 NL1.CNVT DF_03761 1.0 #> 6 NL1.CNVT DF_03777 1.0 #> name #> 1 TESTSET (dataflow, alleen voor TESTSET!) #> 2 TESTSET (dataflow, alleen voor TESTSET!) #> 3 Redenen die een belangrijke rol speelden om uit huis gaan (OG'98),1960-1969 #> 4 Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009 #> 5 Verkiezingsuitslag en zetelverdeling Tweede Kamer, 1963 #> 6 Woonuitgaven #> description #> 1 voor testen .Stat applicaties #> 2 voor testen .Stat applicaties #> 3 Redenen die een belangrijke rol speelden om uit huis te gaan (Onderzoek Gezinsvorming 1998). De tabel heeft betrekking op personen die zijn geboren in de periode 1960 - 1969. Respondenten kunnen meerdere antwoorden hebben gegeven waardoor het totaal niet optelt tot 100 procent.
Frequentie: eenmalig

Gegevens beschikbaar vanaf: 1960 - 1969

Status van de cijfers:
De gegevens zijn definitief.

Wijzigingen per 16 mei 2018:
Geen, deze tabel is stopgezet.

Wanneer komen er nieuwe cijfers?
Niet meer van toepassing. #> 4 De korte-termijnprognose is een actualisering van de lange-termijnprognose 2002-2050 op basis van inmiddels beschikbaar gekomen waarnemingen. Deze prognose voor de lange termijn is begin 2003 gepubliceerd. In de korte-termijnprognose zijn de cijfers tot 1 januari 2009 geactualiseerd.
Voor de periode na 2009 wordt verwezen naar cijfers van lange-termijnprognose.

Gegevens beschikbaar: 2003 tot en met 2009.

Status van de cijfers:
De gegevens in deze tabel zijn definitief.

Wijzigingen per 30 april 2018:
Geen, deze tabel is stopgezet.

Wanneer komen er nieuwe cijfers?
Niet meer van toepassing. #> 5 Deze publicatie geeft informatie over uitgebrachte geldige stemmen en zetelverdeling met betrekking tot de verkiezing van de Tweede Kamer der Staten-Generaal, 15 mei 1963.

Gegevens beschikbaar over 15 mei 1963.

Status van de cijfers:
De gegevens van deze tabel zijn definitief.

Wijzigingen per 8 februari 2019:
Geen, deze tabel is stopgezet.

Wanneer komen er nieuwe cijfers?
Niet meer van toepassing. #> 6 Woonuitgaven.
Huur - en koopsector.
1990, 1994, 1998, 1999, 2000
Gewijzigd op 18 oktober 2002.
Verschijningsfrequentie: Stopgezet. OECD <- sdmxdata::get_endpoint("OECD") dfs_oecd <- OECD |> list_dataflows() dfs_oecd[,1:5] |> head() #> agencyID id version #> 1 ESTAT SEEA_AEA_A 1.4 #> 2 IAEG-SDGs DF_SDG_GLC 1.20 #> 3 IAEG-SDGs DF_SDG_GLH 1.20 #> 4 OECD.CFE.EDS DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_CLIM_PROJ 1.4 #> 5 OECD.CFE.EDS DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_COASTAL_FLOOD 1.1 #> 6 OECD.CFE.EDS DSD_FUA_CLIM@DF_DROUGHT 1.2 #> name #> 1 Air Emissions Accounts #> 2 SDG Country Global Dataflow #> 3 SDG Harmonized Global Dataflow #> 4 Climate projections by scenario, 2030–2060 – Cities and FUAs #> 5 Coastal flooding - Cities and FUAs #> 6 Drought - Cities and FUAs #> description #> 1 Air Emissions Accounts #> 2 Reporting and dissemination dataflow for non-harmonized global SDG indicators reported by countries. #> 3 Reporting and dissemination dataflow for harmonized global SDG indicators. #> 4

This dataset provides sub-national indicators on 2030-2060 projections by scenario on air temperature, hot days, icing days, tropical nights, total precipitation and extreme precipitation days in FUAs and Cities.

\n\n

Data sources and methodology

\n
Projections are based on NASA NEX-GDDP CMIP6 data, which provides average air temperature projections at a 0.25° spatial resolution for different scenarios - Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSPs).
\n\n
\n
    \n
  • Hot days refer to days during which the maximum temperature is higher than 35°C)
    • \n
  • Tropical nights refer to nights during which the minimum temperature is higher than 20°C.
    • \n
  • Icing days are defined as days during which the maximum temperature is lower than 0°C.
    • \n
  • Extreme precipitation days are defined as days during which the total precipitation is higher than 20 mm.
    • \n
\n
\n\n
 
\n
SSPs are climate scenarios up to 2100 that model how socio‑economic factors may change over the next century. These scenarios are combined with Representative Concentration Pathways (RCPs), which outline different greenhouse gas (GHG) concentration levels and their radiative forcings. Radiative forcing quantifies how factors like GHGs, aerosols and solar changes affect Earth’s atmospheric energy balance. This dataset covers highlights four scenarios:
\n
\n
    \n
  • SSP1-2.6: Sustainability. 2.6 watts per square metre (W/m2) radiative forcing, 1.8°C warming by 2100.
    • \n
  • SSP2-4.5: Middle-of-the-road. 4.5 W/m2 radiative forcing, 2.7°C warming by 2100.
    • \n
  • SSP3-7.0: Regional rivalry. 7.0 W/m2 radiative forcing, 3.6°C warming by 2100.
    • \n
  • SSP5-8.5: Fossil fuel development. 8.5 W/m2 radiative forcing, 4.4°C warming by 2100.
    • \n
\n
\n\n

Defining FUAs and cities

\n

The OECD, in cooperation with the EU, has developed a harmonised definition of functional urban areas (FUAs) to capture the economic and functional reach of cities based on daily commuting patterns (OECD, 2012). FUAs consist of:\n

    \n
  1. A city – defined by urban centres in the degree of urbanisation, adapted to the closest local administrative units to define a city.
    2. \n
  2. A commuting zone – including all local areas where at least 15% of employed residents work in the city.
    3. \n
\nThe delineation process includes:\n
    \n
  • Assigning municipalities surrounded by a single FUA to that FUA.
    • \n
  • Excluding non-contiguous municipalities.
    • \n
\nThe definition identifies 1 285 FUAs and 1 402 cities in all OECD member countries except Costa Rica and three accession countries.

\n\n

Cite this dataset

\n

OECD Regions, cities and local areas database (Climate projections by scenario, 2030-2060 – Cities and FUAs), http://oe.cd/geostats

\n\n\n

Further information

\n
    \n
  • OECD Local Data Portal
    • \n
  • OECD Regions and Cities at a Glance
    • \n
\n

For questions and/or comments, please email CitiesStat@oecd.org #> 5

This dataset provides indicators of population and built-up exposure to coastal floods.

\n\n

Data sources and methodology

\n

Coastal flooding indicators are estimated using the Global coastal flood hazard maps (Muis, S. et al., 2016). This dataset provides the extent of coastal floods for different return periods (10 to 100 years) with a 1-kilometre resolution. A return period corresponds to the estimated time interval between floods of similar intensity. Built-up area exposure to coastal floods is computed by intersecting this map with Copernius annual land cover data (Copernicus Climate Change Service, Climate Data Store, 2019) and population exposure is computed using the Global Human Settlement Population layer (European Commission, GHSL Data Package 2023).

\n\n

Defining FUAs and cities

\n

The OECD, in cooperation with the EU, has developed a harmonised definition of functional urban areas (FUAs) to capture the economic and functional reach of cities based on daily commuting patterns (OECD, 2012). FUAs consist of:\n

    \n
  1. A city – defined by urban centres in the degree of urbanisation, adapted to the closest local administrative units to define a city.
    2. \n
  2. A commuting zone – including all local areas where at least 15% of employed residents work in the city.
    3. \n
\nThe delineation process includes:\n
    \n
  • Assigning municipalities surrounded by a single FUA to that FUA.
    • \n
  • Excluding non-contiguous municipalities.
    • \n
\nThe definition identifies 1 285 FUAs and 1 402 cities in all OECD member countries except Costa Rica and three accession countries.

\n

Cite this dataset

\n

OECD Regions, cities and local areas database (Coastal flooding - Cities and FUAs), http://oe.cd/geostats

\n\n

Further information

\n
    \n
  • OECD Local Data Portal
    • \n
  • OECD Regions and Cities at a Glance
    • \n
\n

For questions and/or comments, please email CitiesStat@oecd.org #> 6

This dataset provides regional statistics on estimate of soil moisture anomaly, in Functional Urban Areas (FUAs) and Cities.

\n\n

Data sources and methodology

\n

Drought intensity is here estimated in terms of soil moisture anomaly compared to the reference period 1981-2010. Soil moisture refers to the volume of water in the top soil layer (0 to 7 cm). This dataset provides annual soil moisture estimates in percentage points, along with changes in soil moisture. The data is based on ERA5-Land reanalysis dataset.

\n\n

Defining FUAs and cities

\n

The OECD, in cooperation with the EU, has developed a harmonised definition of functional urban areas (FUAs) to capture the economic and functional reach of cities based on daily commuting patterns (OECD, 2012). FUAs consist of:\n

    \n
  1. A city – defined by urban centres in the degree of urbanisation, adapted to the closest local administrative units to define a city.
    2. \n
  2. A commuting zone – including all local areas where at least 15% of employed residents work in the city.
    3. \n
\nThe delineation process includes:\n
    \n
  • Assigning municipalities surrounded by a single FUA to that FUA.
    • \n
  • Excluding non-contiguous municipalities.
    • \n
\nThe definition identifies 1 285 FUAs and 1 402 cities in all OECD member countries except Costa Rica and three accession countries.

\n\n

Cite this dataset

\n

OECD Regions, cities and local areas database (Drought - Cities and FUAs), http://oe.cd/geostats

\n\n

Further information

\n
    \n
  • OECD Local Data Portal
    • \n
  • OECD Regions and Cities at a Glance
    • \n
\n

For questions and/or comments, please email CitiesStat@oecd.org dataflow_ref <- dfs$ref[4] print(dataflow_ref) #> [1] "NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)" dsd <- CBSbeta |> get_dataflow_structure(ref = dataflow_ref) dsd #> Dataflow: [NL1.CNVT:DF_03726ned(1.0)] #> "Prognose bevolking; kerncijfers, 2003 - 2009" #> agency: "NL1.CNVT", id: "DF_03726ned", version: "1.0" #> #> Observation columns: #> "Topics", "Perioden", "OBS_VALUE", "UNIT_MEASURE", "UNIT_MULT", "OBS_MISSING", "DECIMALS", "OBS_STATUS" #> #> Get a default selection of the observations with: #> obs <- CBSbeta |> get_observations(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT") #> Get a default selection of the data with: #> dat <- CBSbeta |> get_data(id="DF_03726ned", agencyID="NL1.CNVT", pivot="Perioden") #> #> #> Properties: #> $id, $agencyID, $version, $name, $description, $dimensions, $measure, $attributes, $columns, $ref, $flowRef, $raw_sdmx, $default_selection data <- CBSbeta |> get_data(agencyID=dsd$agencyID, id = dsd$id, pivot="Topics") #> #> * `filter_on` argument not specified, using default selection: #> filter_on = list( #> Perioden = c("2003JJ00", "2004JJ00", "2005JJ00", "2006JJ00", "2007JJ00", "2008JJ00", "2009JJ00"), #> Topics = c("TotaleBevolking_1", "k_0Tot20Jaar_2", "k_20Tot65Jaar_3", "k_65JaarOfOuder_4", "k_0Tot20Jaar_5", "k_20Tot65Jaar_6", "EmigratieInclSaldoAdmCorrecties_15", "MigratiesaldoInclSaldoAdmCorr_16") #> ) #> * To select all data, set `filter_on` to `NULL`. head(data) #> Perioden TotaleBevolking_1 k_0Tot20Jaar_2 what: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: Create : known endpoint endpoints use get_endpoint(). unlisted SDMX 2.1 REST endpoint use sdmx_endpoint(). new SDMX endpoint use SDMXEndpoint$new(). Base class SDMX endpoints

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: req httr2::request() object, can adjusted add headers proxy settings version character, SDMX version endpoint id character, id endpoint name character, name endpoint url character, url endpoint verbose logical, TRUE print information connection cache_dir character, directory cache metadata language character, language use text used response

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: SDMXEndpoint$new() SDMXEndpoint$clone()

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: create new SDMXEndpoint object, see also sdmx_endpoint()

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
code: SDMXEndpoint$new(   url,   id = gsub("\\W+", "_", url),   name = url,   language = NULL,   cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "sdmxdata", id),   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Base class for SDMX endpoints — SDMXEndpoint
text: url character, url endpoint id character, id endpoint name character, name endpoint language character, language use text used response cache_dir character, directory cache metadata verbose logical, TRUE print information connection

text: objects class cloneable method.

title: Transform a SDMX data request into a data.frame — as.data.frame.sdmx_v2_1_data_request
code: if (interactive()){   dfs <- list_dataflows()    flowRef <- paste0(dfs[2, c("agencyID", "id", "version")], sep=",")    # json   d <-     sdmx_v2_1_data_request(flowRef = flowRef) |>     as.data.frame()  }

Bureau voor de Statistiek #> 4  OECD                               OECD #> 5   ABS                          AUSTRALIA #> 6   BIS                                BIS #> 7   FAO what: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: Retrieve data SDMX data API. function retrieves data SDMX data API returns data.frame.

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
code: get_data(   endpoint = NULL,   agencyID,   id,   version = "latest",   ref = NULL,   startPeriod = NULL,   endPeriod = NULL,   filter_on = list(),   ...,   dim_contents = c("label", "both", "id"),   obs_value_numeric = TRUE,   raw = FALSE,   language = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   pivot = NULL,   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: endpoint endpoint, url httr2::request() object. agencyID agency ID id id dataflow version version dataflow, default "latest" ref dataflow reference can used stead agencyID, id version startPeriod start period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. endPeriod end period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. filter_on named list filters apply data, specified list(), default selection, set NULL select . ... Additional parameters pass request dim_contents contents dimension columns, either "label", "id" "" obs_value_numeric OBS_VALUE column coerced numeric? Default TRUE raw TRUE return raw data.frame SDMX, otherwise data.frame processed language language metadata cache TRUE cache accompanying  meta data. pivot character name column pivot data . NULL (default) data returned long format. verbose TRUE print information request

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: data.frame

title: Retrieve data from a SDMX data API — get_data
text: get_data similar get_observations(), differs two aspects: returns data columns, attribute columns can pivot observations, .e. can return data wide format, useful feature data multiple measures data presented time series.

what: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: Get information structure  dataflow. dataflow can identified using agencyID, id version using ref argument.

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
code: get_dataflow_structure(   endpoint = NULL,   agencyID = getOption("sdmxdata.agencyID", NULL),   id,   version = "latest",   ref,   language = getOption("sdmxdata.language"),   cache = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: endpoint endpoint object can coerced SDMXEndpoint agencyID agency ID dataflow id id dataflow version version dataflow, defaults "latest" ref string flow reference, form "agencyID:id(version)". Overrules agencyID, id version arguments. language language metadata cache logical, TRUE cache metadata verbose print information console

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: list dataflow information

title: Get information about a dataflow — get_dataflow_structure
text: use cases agencyID id preferred, ref argument includes specific version number dataflow. specifying version number default latest version. desirable pin reference dataflow specific version, ref argument can used. ref argument can also found list_dataflows().

what: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: Get observations SDMX provider. retrieves data SDMX provider returns data.frame.

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
code: get_observations(   endpoint = NULL,   agencyID,   id,   version = "latest",   ref = NULL,   startPeriod = NULL,   endPeriod = NULL,   filter_on = list(),   use_factor = TRUE,   ...,   language = NULL,   as.data.table = FALSE,   dim_contents = c("label", "both", "id"),   attributes_contents = c("label", "id", "both"),   obs_value_numeric = TRUE,   raw = FALSE,   drop_first_columns = !raw,   cache = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: endpoint endpoint, url httr2::request() object. agencyID agency ID id id dataflow version version dataflow, default "latest" ref dataflow reference can used stead agencyID, id version startPeriod start period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. endPeriod end period data returned, works dataflows explicit time dimension. filter_on named list filters apply data, specified list(), default selection, set NULL select . use_factor TRUE dimension attributes columns factors, otherwise character ... Additional parameters pass request language language metadata .data.table TRUE return data.table::data.table(), otherwise data.frame() dim_contents contents dimension columns, either "label", "id" "" attributes_contents contents attribute columns, either "label", "id" "" obs_value_numeric OBS_VALUE column coerced numeric? Default TRUE raw TRUE return raw data.frame SDMX, otherwise data.frame processed drop_first_columns first columns dropped? Default TRUE (raw) cache TRUE cache accompanying  meta data. verbose TRUE print information request

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: data.frame() data.table::data.table() depending .data.table

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations
text: default dimension attribute columns recoded factors labels. can changed dim_contents attributes_contents arguments.

title: Get observations from an SDMX provider — get_observations

what: Get observations using data-explorer url — get_observations_by_url
title: Get observations using data-explorer url — get_observations_by_url
text: Retrieve observations using url data-explorer. url given parsed translated get_observations() call, get started. call printed console can retrieved settings return_query = TRUE.

title: Get observations using data-explorer url — get_observations_by_url
code: get_observations_by_url(url, return_query = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Get observations using data-explorer url — get_observations_by_url
text: url character, REST 2.1 url retrieved external source return_query logical, TRUE return query object instead observation verbose logical, TRUE print information query

title: Get observations using data-explorer url — get_observations_by_url
text: return_query = FALSE data.frame observations, .e. output get_observations(). Otherwise list query object parameters

title: Get observations using data-explorer url — get_observations_by_url
code: # retrieve an external url pointing to sdmx data  url <- "https://sdmx-api.beta.cbs.nl/rest/data/NL1.CNVT,DF_85929NED,1.0/..2022JJ00+2023JJ00?dimensionAtObservation=AllDimensions"  obs <- get_observations_by_url(url) #> Retrieving data using the following statement: #>   get_observations(endpoint = "https://sdmx-api.beta.cbs.nl/rest",  #>       agencyID = "NL1.CNVT", id = "DF_85929NED", version = "1.0",  #>       verbose = FALSE, filter_on = list(Perioden = c("2022JJ00",  #>       "2023JJ00"))) head(obs) #>                           Topics        GrootteklasseInOpslagcapaciteit #> 1 Batterijen; inzet voor opladen   Van meer dan 1 MWh tot en met 10 MWh #> 2 Batterijen; inzet voor opladen   Van meer dan 1 MWh tot en met 10 MWh #> 3     Batterijen; eigen verbruik Van meer dan 10 MWh tot en met 100 MWh #> 4           Batterijen; vermogen  Totaal alle grootteklassen batterijen #> 5           Batterijen; vermogen  Totaal alle grootteklassen batterijen #> 6    Batterijen; aantal systemen   Van meer dan 1 MWh tot en met 10 MWh #>   Perioden OBS_VALUE UNIT_MEASURE UNIT_MULT          OBS_MISSING #> 1     2022     32072      1000kWh  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 2     2023     47217      1000kWh  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 3     2023       979      1000kWh  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 4     2022       132           MW  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 5     2023       229           MW  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #> 6     2023        31       aantal  Eenheden het cijfer is bekend #>                                                     DECIMALS      OBS_STATUS #> 1 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst Nader voorlopig #> 2 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst       Voorlopig #> 3 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst       Voorlopig #> 4 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst Nader voorlopig #> 5 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst       Voorlopig #> 6 het cijfer heeft 0 decimalen of  of de waarde is een tekst       Voorlopig   query <- get_observations_by_url(url, return_query = TRUE) query #> $expr #> get_observations(endpoint = "https://sdmx-api.beta.cbs.nl/rest",  #>     agencyID = "NL1.CNVT", id = "DF_85929NED", version = "1.0",  #>     verbose = FALSE, filter_on = list(Perioden = c("2022JJ00",  #>     "2023JJ00"))) #>  #> $args #> $args$endpoint #> [1] "https://sdmx-api.beta.cbs.nl/rest" #>  #> $args$agencyID #> [1] "NL1.CNVT" #>  #> $args$id #> [1] "DF_85929NED" #>  #> $args$version #> [1] "1.0" #>  #> $args$verbose #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $args$filter_on #> $args$filter_on$Perioden #> [1] "2022JJ00" "2023JJ00" #>  #>  #>

what: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
text: Create endpoint url httr2 request object

title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
code: sdmx_endpoint(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'character' sdmx_endpoint(   x,   id = gsub("\\W+", "_", x),   name = x,   language = NULL,   cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "sdmxdata", id),   verbose = getOption("sdmxdata.verbose", FALSE),   ... )  # S3 method for class 'httr2_request' sdmx_endpoint(x, ...)

title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
text: x endpoint httr2 request object ... saved future use id character, id endpoint name character, name endpoint language character, language use text used response cache_dir character, directory cache metadata verbose logical, TRUE print information connection

title: Create a new SDMX endpoint — sdmx_endpoint
text: SDMXEndpoint object

what: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: sdmx_v2_1_data_request wrapper around smdx rest api v2.1 used retrieve data api.

title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
code: sdmx_v2_1_data_request(   endpoint = NULL,   resource = c("data", "metadata"),   flowRef = NULL,   key = NULL,   providerRef = NULL,   ...,   startPeriod = NULL,   endPeriod = NULL,   updatedAfter = NULL,   firstNObservations = NULL,   lastNObservations = NULL,   dimensionAtObservation = NULL,   detail = c("full", "dataonly", "serieskeysonly", "nodata"),   includeHistory = NULL,   labels = c("both", "id") )

title: Request SDMX data using the SDMX REST API v2.1 — sdmx_v2_1_data_request
text: endpoint endpoint object can coerced endpoint resource resource request. Either "data" "metadata" flowRef flow reference request, see details key key request, see details providerRef provider reference request, see details ... Additional parameters pass request startPeriod start period data returned endPeriod end period data returned updatedAfter return data updated date firstNObservations return first n observations lastNObservations return last n observations dimensionAtObservation dimensions observations returned detail detail data return. Either "full", "dataonly", "serieskeysonly" "nodata" includeHistory Include different versions data labels Include labels data, valid format "csv"
